oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ecto- and endo-parasitic monogeneans (Platyhelminthes) on cultured freshwater exotic fish species in the state of Morelos, South-Central Mexico
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mendoza-Franco, Edgar F.
Caspeta-Mandujano, Juan Manuel
Osorio, Marina Tapia
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: fresh water
Platyhelminthes
invasive species
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: <jats:p>An extensive parasitological study of 365 freshwater exotic fish specimens belonging to 13 species of seven families (Cichlidae, Cyprinidae, Osphronemidae, Pangasidae, Poeciliidae, Characidae, and Loricariidae) collected from 31 Aquaculture Production Units (APU) from Central Mexico revealed the occurrence of 29 ecto- and endo-parasitic monogeneans found on gills and stomachs: <jats:italic>Cichlidogyrussclerosus</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>C.thurstonae</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>C.tilapiae</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>Cichlidogyrus</jats:italic> sp. 1, <jats:italic>Cichlidogyrus</jats:italic> sp. 2, <jats:italic>Enterogyruscoronatus</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>E.malmbergi</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>Gusseviaspiralocirra</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>Sciadicleithrumiphthimum</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>Sciadicleithrum</jats:italic> sp., <jats:italic>Scutogyruslongicornis</jats:italic> (all Dactylogyridae), <jats:italic>Gyrodactyluscichlidarum</jats:italic>, and <jats:italic>G.yacatli</jats:italic> (Gyrodactylidae) on <jats:italic>Oreochromisniloticus</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>Pterophyllumscalare</jats:italic> and <jats:italic>Hemichromis</jats:italic> sp. (Cichlidae); <jats:italic>Dactylogyrusbaueri</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>D.formosus</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>D.intermedius</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>D.vastator</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>D.extensus</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>Dactylogyrus</jats:italic> sp. (all Dactylogyridae), and <jats:italic>G.kobayashii</jats:italic> on <jats:italic>Carassiusauratus</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>Cyprinuscarpio</jats:italic> and <jats:italic>Ctenopharyngodonidella</jats:italic> (Cyprinidae); <jats:italic>Trianchoratusacleithrium</jats:italic> and <jats:italic>T.trichogasterium</jats:italic> (Dactylogyridae) on <jats:italic>Trichogastertrichopterus</jats:italic> (Osphronemidae); <jats:italic>Thaparocleiduscaecus</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>T.siamensis</jats:italic> (Dactylogyridae), and Dactylogyridae sp. on <jats:italic>Pangasianodonhypophthalmus</jats:italic> (Pangasidae); <jats:italic>G.poeciliae</jats:italic> on <jats:italic>Poeciliareticulata</jats:italic> (Poeciliidae); <jats:italic>Diaphorocleidusarmillatus</jats:italic> (Dactylogyridae) on <jats:italic>Gymnocorymbusternetzy</jats:italic> (Characidae); <jats:italic>Unilatusunilatus</jats:italic> (Dactylogyridae) and Gyrodactylidae sp. on <jats:italic>Hypostomus</jats:italic> sp. (Loricariidae). The paramount importance of the establishment of these monogeneans due to the importation/exportation of non-native ornamental and other exotic host fish species cultured for food in Mexico is briefly discussed. Quarantine is recommended for all transferred host species.</jats:p>
